I’m proud of the #bipartisan support in the committee today, and I will continue working to try to prevent this misguided plan to scale back GI Bill transferability from going into effect next month.

Groups like the @IAVA joined in opposition to the restrictions, calling them “outrageous” and that the new changes “hurt our readiness, hurt our recruitment, hurt morale, and are bad for military families.” https://iava.org/press-release/over-54000-iava-supporters-sign-petition-against-gi-bill-transferability-changes/ …

I led a letter signed by 83 bipartisan members of Congress expressed serious concern that this plan sends “exactly the wrong message” and “sets a dangerous precedent for the removal of other critical benefits as members approach #military retirement.” pic.twitter.com/cb6xyuQLKy

Last year, @DeptofDefense announced a new policy to prevent service members with greater than 16 years of service from transferring their Post-9/11 GI Bill benefits to eligible family members. This benefit was a key part of the Post-9/11 GI Bill I helped pass into law in 2008.

.@HASCDemocrats just passed my #fy20NDAA amendment to prevent @deptofdefense restrictions on GI Bill transferability like those due to go into effect next month. While @ActingSecDef should reconsider this decision entirely, strong support today should be clear sign to slow down. pic.twitter.com/ggoXL9zTdL

Just passed the readiness portion of the #FY20NDAA which includes critical support for @SUBASE_NLON & the surrounding community:  

✔️$72 million for new pier at the SUBASE
✔️expanded oversight of off-base housing  
✔️$50 million to support infrastructure projects around bases

Our #FY20NDAA provides a strong bipartisan investment in shipbuilding and @USNavy fleet needs:  

✔️11 new battle force ships 
✔️Fully funds 3 submarine repair availabilities to address backlogs  
✔️Rejects plan to cancel refueling of an aircraft carrier

The future of our sealift capabilities is a critical national security concern for our nation – and without action, we will lose the ability to transport equipment and people in a crisis. This will remain a top priority for our panel moving ahead.

Our bill also focuses on the future of our domestic sealift and maritime fleet: 

✔️long-term reauthorization of the Maritime Security Program  
✔️new fuel Tanker Security Program  
✔️new-build domestic sealift vessel program 
✔rejects cut to mariner training ships 

#FY20NDAA

The #seapower portion also supports other critical CT priorities:  

✔️fully funds B-21 bomber development  
✔️12 KC-46A tankers with @prattandwhitney engines  
✔️ expands modernization of C-130 aircraft flown by @CTNationalGuard
✔️ development of @USMC unmanned helo at Kaman

The #FY20NDAA reflects my ongoing work to boost submarine production fueling manufacturing growth at @GDElectricBoat and across our region: 

✔️adds a third Virginia-class submarine 
✔️fully funds Columbia class production 
✔️adds $125 million for development of supplier base

We’re starting debate on my portion of the #FY20NDAA, reflecting the work of the #Seapower & Projection Forces Subcommittee. I worked hard with @RobWittman to produce a bipartisan product backing priorities on, above, and below the seas. http://bit.ly/2ZgjkMk

We just approved the air-land section of the #FY20NDAA, which makes a strong investment in CTs' #aerospace sector. The bill includes 90 F-35s with engines built by @prattandwhitney in CT– 12 more than the budget.

Right now in @HASCDemocrats, we’re kicking off debate on the #FY20NDAA, our annual defense authorization bill. This is my first year as a chairman leading the #Seapower subcommittee, and I’ve worked hard to support important priorities for CT.
